hook.text: A unit test checks one small piece of code in isolation. If it breaks, you know exactly where.

buildup.text: Good unit tests run in milliseconds and cover edge cases that manual testing would miss.

discovery.text: A solid test suite lets you refactor fearlessly. Change the code and the tests confirm nothing broke.

twist.text: Writing tests doubles as design feedback. If code is hard to test, the design is probably wrong.

climax.text: Teams with high test coverage release faster because they spend less time on manual regression.

punchline.text: Test the small parts. The big picture follows.

quiz.question: Why do unit tests improve software design?
